intro: Ferolia pohlii, commonly known as the Pohli's ferolia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to its rarity, Ferolia pohlii is considered vulnerable and requires protection to ensure its survival.
